feat.name: World Traveler
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Pathfinding
entries: You gain the ability to cast the spell {@spell Pathfinding|CompendiumofAcadia} without a spell slot, and you always have it prepared. You can do so a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. These uses are replenished after completing a Long Rest, during which you must spend at least 1 hour in a process called Syphoning.

entries.name: Syphoning
entries: You can enter Syphoning, you attune to the ambient flow of mana around you, entering a trance-like state. In this state, you experience vivid hallucinations of objects, creatures, and places that can be entirely imaginary or drawn from any time, place, or reality.
These visions might originate from your imagination, other worlds, alternate dimensions, or distant timelines.

feat.name: Cosmopolitan

otherSummary.entry: Be a {@variantrule Pathfinder|CompendiumofAcadia} and Have {@feat World Traveler|CompendiumofAcadia} feat

entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Planar Translation
entries: You gain the ability to cast the spell {@spell Planar Translation|CompendiumofAcadia} without a spell slot, and you always have it prepared. To use this feature, you must expend one use of your Pathfinding feature from the {@feat World Traveler|CompendiumofAcadia} feat.

feat.name: Acadian Latent Power
entries: You awaken an Acadian Latent Power, a unique ability tailored to your character's narrative and thematic elements. These powers are developed collaboratively with your DM and should align with the power level of a Wizard subclass feature of the same level.
Each power must use Mana as a fuel source. If the ability is passive, it must also include an optional feature or enhancement that consumes Mana to activate or function at a greater scale.
You can gain this feat up to four times, but each acquisition has a level requirement: level 3 for the first, level 6 for the second, level 10 for the third, and level 14 for the fourth.

entries.name: Forge Holy Weapon
entries: You can summon a sacred weapon associated with your deity. By using a Magic action, you conjure a melee martial weapon into existence. The weapon's damage die becomes {@damage 1d10} and it deals Radiant damage instead of its usual type.
If the weapon is versatile or two-handed, it deals {@damage 1d12} damage when wielded with two hands.
After hitting a creature with this weapon, you can expend 2 {@variantrule âšª White Mana|CompendiumofAcadia} to deal an additional {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage.

entries.name: Reality Ripple
entries: You can momentarily shift through space, allowing you to teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. This requires a bonus action and can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.
All expended uses are restored when you finish a Long Rest.
If you have no remaining uses, you can spend 1 {@variantrule ðŸ”µ Blue Mana|CompendiumofAcadia} to regain a number of uses equal to half your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Bad Omen
entries: You gain the {@feat Lucky|XPHB} feat.
At the start of your turn, you can spend 2 {@variantrule âš« Black Mana|CompendiumofAcadia} to extend your luck to others for 1 minute.
During this time, you can use your Lucky rerolls on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|d20 Tests} made by any creature you can see within 30 feet.

entries.name: Dark Blood
entries: When you roll initiative, you gain 5 temporary hit points as your vitality surges.
By expending 1 {@variantrule ðŸ”´ Red Mana|CompendiumofAcadia}, you can enhance this effect, gaining 15 temporary hit points instead.
Additionally, you can use a Magic action to spend 2 {@variantrule ðŸ”´ Red Mana|CompendiumofAcadia} and gain 15 temporary hit points at any time during combat.

entries.name: Fury of the Forest Protector
entries: You can channel the raw strength of nature to empower your melee strikes. As a bonus action, you can change the mastery of your melee weapon to 'Push' for 1 minute. If you do not normally have access to weapon masteries, this feature grants you temporary access to the 'Push' mastery for the weapon you are wielding when activating this feature.

Additionally, you can spend 1 {@variantrule ðŸŸ¢ Green Mana|CompendiumofAcadia} when you activate this ability to deal extra damage if a creature is pushed into a wall or similar structure. For every 5 feet the creature is unable to move due to the obstruction, it takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage. At the DM's discretion, the wall or structure may also take the same amount of damage.

feat.name: Mage Catcher
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Great Stability
entries: You gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Saving Throws against effects that would forcibly move you.

entries.name: Deny Casting
entries: When a creature you're grappling attempts to cast a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material Components, they must make a Concentration Check (DC 8 + your Strength modifier + Proficiency Bonus). On failure, the spell fails and the spell slot isn't expended.
